b11.name: Aspen Valley
b11.notes:
• This trail is not used often and portions of the trail are overgrown with vegetation. Bring a good map of the area.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300' from water.

h29b.name: Beehive Meadow
h29b.alert: Overnight parking at Hetch Hetchy will be limited this spring due to construction. Please carpool or reduce the number of vehicles per group.

w32.name: Bridalveil Creek
w32.notes: • You may not camp at Bridalveil Creek Campground with this permit.

x03.name: Budd Creek (cross-country only)
x03.alert: This is a cross-country trailhead, and the trail/route is not maintained. All members of the party must be proficient at backcountry navigation.
x03.notes:
• Camping is prohibited in the Budd Lake and Elizabeth Lake drainages.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

t21.name: Cathedral Lakes
t21.notes:
• Fires are prohibited at Upper and Lower Cathedral Lakes.
  • Camping is prohibited in the Budd Lake and Elizabeth Lake drainages.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

w36.name: Chilnualna Falls
w36.notes:
• Only use existing fire rings. Building new fire rings is not allowed.
  • You must be at the top of Chilnualna Falls before camping.

h26a.name: Cottonwood Creek
h26a.notes: • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

x04.name: Gaylor Creek (cross-country only)
x04.alert: This is a cross-country trailhead, and the trail/route is not maintained. All members of the party must be proficient at backcountry navigation.
x04.notes:
• No camping in the park from Great Sierra Mine to White Mountain and all watershed downstream, including Gaylor Lakes.
  • No camping in the Monroe Hall Research Area.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

w03b.name: Glacier Point to Illilouette
w03b.notes:
• Please remember you must travel as far as the Buena Vista Trail junction before camping.
  • You may not camp in Little Yosemite Valley your first night with this permit.
  • Camping is not allowed along the Panorama Trail or at the top of Illilouette Fall.

w03a.name: Glacier Point to Little Yosemite Valley
w03a.description: Trailhead availability does not reflect availability for Donohue Pass or Half Dome Cables.
w03a.notes:
• You must get to Little Yosemite Valley before camping. You must camp your first night at Little Yosemite Valley.
  • Bear boxes and composting toilet are available at the campground. Bears have obtained food from backpackers in this area.

y03a.name: Glacier Point to Little Yosemite Valley
y03a.description: Trailhead availability does not reflect availability for Donohue Pass or Half Dome Cables.
y03a.notes:
• You must get to Little Yosemite Valley before camping. You must camp your first night at Little Yosemite Valley.
  • Bear boxes and composting toilets are there for your use.

j03a.name: Glacier Point to Little Yosemite Valley (Donohue Pass only)
j03a.description: We will begin accepting applications for the rolling lottery on December 28 corresponding to an entry date of June 15. Please refer to the reservation schedule to see when to submit your application for your range of dates.
j03a.notes:
• You must get to Little Yosemite Valley before camping. You must camp your first night at Little Yosemite Valley.
  • Bear boxes and composting toilets are there for your use.

t22a.name: Glen Aulin
t22a.notes:
• You must camp at the Glen Aulin High Sierra Camp backpackers campground your first night.
  • Bears are very active and have obtained food from backpackers in this area.
  • Fires are permitted only in the established community fire rings.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace rules.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

t22b.name: Glen Aulin Pass Thru to Cold Canyon or Waterwheel Falls
t22b.notes:
• You may not camp at the Glen Aulin High Sierra Camp backpackers camp your first night with this permit.
  • Bears have been successful in getting food from backpackers in this area.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

y01c.name: Happy Isles to Illilouette
y01c.notes: • You may not camp at Little Yosemite Valley your first night with this permit.

y01b.name: Happy Isles to Little Yosemite Valley
y01b.description: Trailhead availability does not reflect availability for Donohue Pass or Half Dome Cables.
y01b.notes:
• You must get to Little Yosemite Valley before camping. You must camp your first night at Little Yosemite Valley.
  • Bear boxes and composting toilet are available at the campground. Bears have obtained food from backpackers in this area.

j01b.name: Happy Isles to Little Yosemite Valley (Donohue Pass only)
j01b.description: We will begin accepting applications for the rolling lottery on December 28 corresponding to an entry date of June 15. Please refer to the reservation schedule to see when to submit your application for your range of dates.
j01b.notes:
• You must get to Little Yosemite Valley before camping. You must camp your first night at Little Yosemite Valley.
  • Bear boxes and composting toilet are available at the campground.

y01a.name: Happy Isles to Sunrise/Merced Lake Pass Thru
y01a.description: Trailhead availability does not reflect availability for Donohue Pass or Half Dome Cables.
y01a.notes:
• You must camp beyond Little Yosemite Valley and Moraine Dome.
  • Bears have obtained food from backpackers in this area. There are bear lockers at Merced Lake backpackers camp.

j01a.name: Happy Isles to Sunrise/Merced Lake Pass Thru (Donohue Pass only)
j01a.description: We will begin accepting applications for the rolling lottery on December 28 corresponding to an entry date of June 15. Please refer to the reservation schedule to see when to submit your application for your range of dates.
j01a.notes:
• You must camp beyond Little Yosemite Valley and Moraine Dome.
  • Bears have obtained food from backpackers in this area. There are bear lockers at Merced Lake backpackers camp.

b13b.name: Luken to Luken's Lake
b13b.notes: • Camping is not permitted at Luken's Lake.

b13a.name: Luken to Yosemite Creek
b13a.notes:
• Camp at least one-half mile back from the rim of the Valley.
  • The area around the top of Yosemite Falls is for day use only.

t24b.name: Lyell Canyon
t24b.description: Trailhead availability does not reflect availability for Donohue Pass.
t24b.notes:
• Travel at least four miles out Lyell Canyon before camping.
  • Bears have been successful in getting food from backpackers in this area. Bear canisters are required.
  • No fires above 9,600 feet.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace rules.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

j24b.name: Lyell Canyon (Donohue Pass only)
j24b.description: We will begin accepting applications for the rolling lottery on December 28 corresponding to an entry date of June 15. Please refer to the reservation schedule to see when to submit your application for your range of dates.
j24b.notes:
• Travel at least four miles out Lyell Canyon before camping.
  • Bears have been successful in getting food from backpackers in this area. Bear canisters are required.
  • No fires above 9,600 feet.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace rules.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

b17.name: May Lake
b17.notes:
• All food and toiletries must be stored in proper food storage containers.
  • Only use existing fire rings.
  • Pack out all trash, including toilet paper.

b16.name: May Lake to Snow Creek
b16.alert: An area closure is in effect to the south and east of the Snow Creek footbridge. Learn more.
b16.notes: • Bears are active in this area. Do not place your bear canister near a cliff.

w31a.name: McGurk Meadow
w31a.notes: • You must be four trail miles from Glacier Point before camping. No camping east of the Bridalveil Creek footbridge.

h29a.name: Miguel Meadows
h29a.alert: Overnight parking at Hetch Hetchy will be limited this spring due to construction. Please carpool or reduce the number of vehicles per group.

y02.name: Mirror Lake to Snow Creek
y02.alert: An area closure is in effect to the south and east of the Snow Creek footbridge. Learn more.
y02.notes:
• You must camp beyond the top of the switchbacks and outside of the closure area to the south and east of the Snow Creek footbridge.
  • Bears are active in this area. Do not put your bear canister next to a cliff.

w34.name: Mono Meadow
w34.notes:
• You may not camp in Little Yosemite Valley your first night with this permit.
  • Camping is not allowed along the Panorama Trail or at the top of Illilouette Fall.

t25.name: Mono/Parker Pass
t25.notes:
• Travel across Mono Pass before camping.
  • The Parker Pass Creek watershed is closed to camping, travel over Parker Pass before camping.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

t20.name: Murphy Creek
t20.notes: • Bears have been successful in getting food from backpackers in this area. All food, toiletries, aromatic goods, and garbage must be stored in the canister.

x02.name: Nelson Lake (cross-country only)
x02.alert: This is a cross-country trailhead, and the trail/route is not maintained. All members of the party must be proficient at backcountry navigation.
x02.notes:
• Cross-country restrictions are in effect. The maximum group size is 8. Learn more.
  • Fires are prohibited at Nelson and Reyman Lakes.
  • Camping is prohibited at Elizabeth Lake.
  • Bears are active in this area.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

y08.name: Old Big Oak Flat Road
y08.notes:
• Camp at least one-half mile back from the rim of the Valley.
  • The area around the top of the falls is for day use only.

w33.name: Ostrander Lake
w33.notes:
• All food and toiletries must be stored in proper food storage containers.
  • Only use existing fire rings.
  • Pack out all trash, including toilet paper.

w03c.name: Pohono Trail (Glacier Point)
w03c.notes: • You must be four trail miles from Glacier Point before camping. No camping east of the Bridalveil Creek footbridge.

w05.name: Pohono Trail (Taft Point)
w05.notes: • You must be four trail miles from Glacier Point before camping. No camping east of the Bridalveil Creek footbridge including Taft Point.

y07.name: Pohono Trail (Wawona Tunnel)
y07.notes: • No camping east of the Bridalveil Creek footbridge. Only use existing fire rings.

h27.name: Poopenaut Valley
h27.notes:
• Bears have been successful in getting food from backpackers in the Hetch Hetchy area.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

b15.name: Porcupine Creek
b15.notes: • Bears are active in this area. Do not place your bear canister near a cliff.

t24a.name: Rafferty Creek to Vogelsang
t24a.alert: There is no longer a toilet at the Vogelsang backpackers campground near Fletcher Lake. If staying at Fletcher Lake please disperse several hunderd feet from the campground boundary when going to the bathroom.
t24a.notes:
• Fires are prohibited in the Vogesang area, at Boothe Lake, and above 9,600 feet.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

h29c.name: Rancheria Falls
h29c.alert: Overnight parking at Hetch Hetchy will be limited this spring due to construction. Please carpool or reduce the number of vehicles per group.
h29c.notes:
• Swimming and watering of stock directly in streams within one mile of the Reservoir is prohibited. Closure includes Wapama Falls, Rancheria Cascade.
  • Bears active in Rancheria area.
  • The Tuolumne River is water source for San Francisco. Please preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

x01.name: Rockslides (cross-country only)
x01.alert: This is a cross-country trailhead, and the trail/route is not maintained. All members of the party must be proficient at backcountry navigation.
x01.notes:
• Cross-country restrictions are in effect. The maximum group size is 8. Learn more.
  • Camp at least one-half mile back from the rim of the Valley.
  • The area around the top of the falls is for day use only.

h28.name: Smith Peak
h28.notes: • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

b10.name: South Fork of Tuolumne River
b10.notes:
• The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

t19.name: Sunrise Lakes
t19.description: Trailhead availability does not reflect availability for Donohue Pass.
t19.notes:
• Bears have successfully obtained food from backpackers in this area on a regular basis. Store all food and toiletries in a bear canister.
  • Camp at least 100 feet from any water source.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

j19.name: Sunrise Lakes (Donohue Pass only)
j19.description: We will begin accepting applications for the rolling lottery on December 28 corresponding to an entry date of June 15. Please refer to the reservation schedule to see when to submit your application for your range of dates.
j19.notes:
• Bears have successfully obtained food from backpackers in this area on a regular basis. Store all food and toiletries in a bear canister.
  • Camp at least 100 feet from any water source.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

y09.name: Tamarack Creek
y09.notes:
• You may not camp at Tamarack Flat Campground with this permit.
  • Camp at least one-half mile back from the rim of the Valley.
  • The area around the top of Yosemite Falls is for day use only.

b14b.name: Ten Lakes
b14b.notes:
• Fires are not allowed above 9600 feet and are permitted only in existing fire rings below that elevation.
  • Bears are active in this area.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

b12b.name: White Wolf Campground
b12b.notes:
• You may not camp at White Wolf Campground with this permit.
  • The Tuolumne River watershed is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.

b12c.name: White Wolf to Aspen Valley
b12c.alert: The road to White Wolf is closed. You may access the trailhead from Tioga Road.
b12c.notes:
• This trail is not used often and portions of the trail are overgrown with vegetation. Bring a good map of the area.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

b12a.name: White Wolf to Pate Valley
b12a.alert: The road to White Wolf is closed. You may access the trailhead from Tioga Road.
b12a.notes:
• Bears are active in Pate Valley.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

b12d.name: White Wolf to Smith Meadow
b12d.alert: The road to White Wolf is closed. You may access the trailhead from Tioga Road.
b12d.notes:
• This trail is not used often and portions of the trail are overgrown with vegetation. Bring a good map of the area.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

b14a.name: Yosemite Creek
b14a.notes:
• Camp at least one-half mile back from the rim of the Valley.
  • The area around the top of Yosemite Falls is for day use only.

y06.name: Yosemite Falls
y06.notes:
• Camp at least one-half mile back from the rim of the Valley.
  • The area around the top of Yosemite Falls and around Yosemite Point is for day use only.

t23.name: Young Lakes via Dog Lake
t23.notes:
• Fires are not allowed at Young Lakes or anywhere in the park above 9,600 feet.
  • Bears are active in this area. The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.

t22c.name: Young Lakes via Glen Aulin Trail
t22c.wpsName: Young Lakes via Glen Aulin Trail
t22c.notes:
• Fires are not allowed at Young Lakes or anywhere in the park above 9,600 feet.
  • Bears are active in this area.
  • The Tuolumne River is a water source for San Francisco. Follow Leave No Trace camping techniques to preserve water quality.
  • Along the Tuolumne Watershed, ensure all washing and waste is 300 feet from water.
